cab.content: Military; Secret.963From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,mil June 1919.- - (Received 26th, at 11.30 p.m.)8690. No. 46. Parti.1. No change in situation. Whole of border generally quiet. Dakka reports decrease in tribal gatherings in Ningrahar.2. Nadir Khan is still interviewing Waziris and Mahsud Maliks and said to be promising them inclusion in Afghanistan peace terms, and support should hostilities recommence.Part II. :-3. Health of troops good in Baluchistan ; fair elsewhere. Cholera almost ceased in Khyber and Kohat-Kuram, but prevalent in Waziristan Force. Since coinmence-ment of outbreak on 17th May there have been 1,277 cases, and 460 deaths, of which 74 and 17 respectively were British.Paragraph 2 and details of 3 not communicated to Press.
